page.title: 04FARMING
page.content: There are 11 farms in the area. Some are quite small, less than 100 acres; others are larger, between 100 and 200 acres. The main crop is grass, used directly as pasture or made into silage or hay. The other sorts of crops are oilseed rape, barley, turnips for animal feed, and potatoes. The animals kept are mainly sheep and cattle, the sheep for wool and meat, cattle for milk and meat. The farms are mechanised, with an average of about 2 workers, and some contractors help at busier times. In Ivegill there is a Herb Farm, whose produce is processed and sold locally.
